de.lergin.laborus.api

Class JobAction<T extends JobItem>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lergin.laborus.api.JobAction<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the Type of the JobItems used by this JobAction should be set to a type of JobItems in the implementation
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BreakBlockJobAction, EntityDamageJobAction, EntityKillJobAction, EntityTameJobAction, InteractJobAction, PlaceBlockJobAction

    public abstract class JobAction<T extends JobItem>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    an action that can award some xp and so one it needs to be registered with the JobService in the GamePreInitialization phase: JobService jobService = Sponge.getServiceManager().getRegistration(JobService.class).get().getProvider(); jobService.registerJobAction(Class.class, "nameForTheConfig"); The JobAction need to implement Serializable which is done in the Simplest way by using the @ConfigSerializable annotation. The JobAction should have a Listener that listens to an event and then calls on of the onEvent() methods. The Listener will be registered by Laborus in the init() method. For an example you can look at (@see EntityDamageJobAction)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      does the same as (@see onEvent) but also handles the canceling of the event and sending of messages to the player if he cannot do the action

      • onEvent

        public JobActionState onEvent(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player player,
                              java.util.function.BooleanSupplier isWorking,
                              java.util.concurrent.Callable<T> getJobItem)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        handles the awarding of the JobAction
        Parameters:
        player - the player that has done the action
        isWorking - a supplier that returns if the jobAction can be awarded (eg. to check if all data is available
        getJobItem - a supplier that returns the JobItem that was used in the action
        Returns:
        the state of the action
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - exception if something in one of the suppliers isn't working
